interviewer_dialogue: Hi, this is Interviewer, the landlord.

patient_dialogue: Hi, Interviewer. It’s Patient in Apartment 1A. I called you uh.. last week about the leak in the ceiling. Do you remember?
interviewer_dialogue: Yeah. I’m sorry. I haven’t had enough time to get over to fix it, but I’ve been very busy.

patient_dialogue: I understand. The- the leak has gotten much worse and now, it’s gone from a leak to a steady drip and I think it’s something we probably need to look at fairly quickly because it’s damaging the ceiling, not to mention some of my furniture.
So, when- when can I expect you here to fix the leak?
interviewer_dialogue: Well, it might take me about a week, maybe even two weeks before I’ll have time to fix it.

patient_dialogue: Well, I- I really think you need to look at it sooner than that because it’s really starting to-- it gets worse every day and from a structural standpoint, uh.. the apartment needs to be taken care of because internet of things only are you gonna have damage. I’m gonna have damage as well.
So, uh.. I- I think you really need to look at it a lot sooner than a week. How about- how about tomorrow?
interviewer_dialogue: Uhm.. well, I do all the repairs myself for the whole building.

patient_dialogue: Okay and is any of the repairs you have lined up as bad as a ceiling falling down?
interviewer_dialogue: Uh.. yeah, I have a lot of other tenants with problems that are ahead of yours.

patient_dialogue: Okay. So, what do you suggest I do about this water leak in the apartment?
interviewer_dialogue: Well, uh.. what have you done about the problem so far?

patient_dialogue: Well, nothing because it’s really not my problem. It’s your problem. I didn’t move my furniture around but uh.. I didn’t notice it until after it dripped on the couch quite a bit, but I have since moved the couch. But now, it’s affecting the floorboards. The wood is starting to warp in the floor and- and all of that is gonna, you know, it’s gonna be a cost and an expense to you, not me.
So, I think you need to get here sooner rather than later. So, how about you come tomorrow? Hello? Are you there?
interviewer_dialogue: Uhm.. yeah. It- it might take me about a week, maybe even two weeks before I’ll have time to fix it.

patient_dialogue: Well, that’s kinda-- that’s unacceptable. Uh.. how about I-- how about we do this-- for every day you don’t show up, I take that daily rental amount off my next month’s rent amount?
interviewer_dialogue: Uhm.. well, I’m- I’m aware of the problem and I’ll be over as soon as I can.

patient_dialogue: Okay and soon as you can is when?
interviewer_dialogue: Uhm.. it- it’ll still be about a week or two weeks, but I- I’ll be over as soon as I can.

patient_dialogue: Okay. Uh.. could I possibly get the name of the owner of the building?

interviewer_dialogue: Yeah. Sure. But I- I gotta go right now. I’ll give you a call right back real quick, okay?

patient_dialogue: Well, that’s un- unacceptable. I really would like the name of the owner now and a phone number.
interviewer_dialogue: Okay. Uhm.. just real quick. I’ll give you a call back. Okay?

patient_dialogue: Uh.. no. It’s not okay. I need a phone number and it shouldn’t take you but a second to give it to me.
